teaser: Citigroup pays up for past deeds. Earlier this week, we learned the SEC is investigating Ally Financial for its own mortgage practices around that time. Isaac is back to tropical storm status. Mitt Romney is scheduled to accept the GOP nomination for president tonight. In the meantime, we talk with residents of Florida coastal town New Smyrna Beach to get a sense of "The Real Economy" there.
byline: Kate Archer Kent, David Gura, Jeremy Hobson, Mitchell Hartman, Frank Newport, Mark Garrison, Peter van Dyk, Sabri Ben-Achour, Jeff Horwich and Ryan Faughnder
title: Marketplace Morning Report for Thursday, August 30, 2012
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Thursday, August 30, 2012
description: Citigroup pays up for past deeds. Earlier this week, we learned the SEC is investigating Ally Financial for its own mortgage practices around that time. Isaac is back to tropical storm status. Mitt Romney is scheduled to accept the GOP nomination for president tonight. In the meantime, we talk with residents of Florida coastal town New Smyrna Beach to get a sense of "The Real Economy" there.
